name: Oslo
fun_fact: Fun fact: Brunost (brown cheese) was invented by farmer's wife Anne Hov in the 1860s and became so important to Norway's economy that she received the King's Medal for Merit in 1933 - Norwegians eat it for breakfast, lunch, dinner, and even on waffles!

hero_dishes.name: F친rik친l
hero_dishes.description: Slow-cooked lamb and cabbage stew with peppercorns - Norway's national dish
hero_dishes.origin_story: Voted national dish in 1970s radio program, celebrated last Thursday of September

hero_dishes.name: Brunost
hero_dishes.description: Sweet caramel-like brown cheese made from whey, goat's and cow's milk
hero_dishes.origin_story: Created by Anne Hov in 1863, she received King's Medal for Merit
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Every grocery store, Harald's Vaffel serves it on waffles

hero_dishes.description: Sausage wrapped in soft potato flatbread

hero_dishes.description: Salted and dried lamb ribs steamed over birch branches

signature_drinks.name: Norwegian Coffee
signature_drinks.description: Norway has one of world's highest coffee consumptions per capita
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Throughout the day, strong and black

food_culture_notes: Dovrehallen at Storgata 22 is haven of Norwegian gastronomic heritage
